review: It's an okay system. I'm not totally blown away.  With the given specs I expected it to blow the Apple TV out of the the water but it doesn't.  The apps tend to stop from time to time so I'm giving it to the kids and keeping the Apple TV.  The system layout has a lot going on and its not simple at all.  You can't power off or restart so that's a bummer too.
author: Franscoir Hart

review: I bought this for the wife and kids.  We had been using a DVD player to access Amazon Prime content.  I thought this would be much easier and it truly is.  It was simple to set up and within five minuets we were watching a movie.  The only grip I have is Comcast is not supported.  With Comcast not being supported we do lose some functionality of the apps, such as HBOGO and any that require you to sign in to your cable provider.  I'm sure that eventually Amazon and Comcast will come to some sort of agreement and all will be well.  Since we have a full cable package as well as the Fire, this isn't a huge problem for us but if you are relying on the Fire to provide those channels then you have to make the call.  Overall I think this was a great purchase.
